intro: Cyphostemma pseudosesquipedale, commonly known as the African moon vine, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by distinctive, elongated fruits. Its leaves and stems are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. The plant thrives in arid or semi-arid environments and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
